list_definition.definition: (also chip) computing a very small piece of silicon or another semiconductor that carries a series of electrical circuits and is used in computers and other machines

list_ex_of_english: Second, increased use of microchips and biosensors is likely to make healthcare more proactive and preventative rather than reactive and episodic.
The expanded use of implantable microchips and biosensors will only make this task more difficult.
He talked about microchipping and made a plea for one approved microchip.
It also promised to ensure the fulfilment of the plan for microchips.
As a telescope extends our ability to see long distances, this particular application of an implantable microchip increases our ability to "see" where our pets are.
Your car is full of microchips.
The situation is different, however, with the solid state microchip laser subject to a semiconductor saturable absorber.
The tags contain microchips that transmit signals to receivers built into the shelves around the store.
